- [Ullman et al., Mining of Massive Datasets](http://www.mmds.org/){target="_blank"} ([Chapter 3: Finding Similar Items,](http://infolab.stanford.edu/~ullman/mmds/ch3n.pdf){target="_blank"} [Chapter 9: Recommendation Systems](http://infolab.stanford.edu/~ullman/mmds/ch9.pdf){target="_blank"})

## Demo

Clone [this repository:](https://github.com/dapagyi/dmml-recsys){target="_blank"}

```bash
git clone git@github.com:dapagyi/dmml-recsys.git
```

Then, navigate to the folder and start the demo API (e.g. using `uv` as [package and dependency manager](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/){target="_blank"}):

```bash
cd dmml-recsys/dmml-recsys-api
uv run litestar --app src.app:app run --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000
```

Set `http://localhost:8000` as your API URL [in the frontend application.](https://apagyidavid.web.elte.hu/2025-2026-1/dmml/recsys){target="_blank"} 

While developing, you can test your recommenders separately:

```
(dmml-recsys-api) david@david-thinkpad:~/code/dmml-packages/dmml-recsys/dmml-recsys-api$ python src/rec_test.py
Top 5 tag-based recommendations for item_id 1 (Toy Story):
Item ID: 2355 (A Bug's Life), Score: 0.9013892751944388
Item ID: 3114 (Toy Story 2), Score: 0.5772673193368394
Item ID: 122918 (Guardians of the Galaxy 2), Score: 0.4330096702897574
Item ID: 68954 (Up), Score: 0.2260398610190949
Item ID: 115617 (Big Hero 6), Score: 0.15214187468804743
```

__Exercise:__ Try to come up with your own recommendation algorithm and implement it in the demo API (in the `src/recommenders.py` file).
